intro: Rhytachne gabonensis, commonly known as the Gabon bristleleaf, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found in moist, tropical forests and can grow up to several meters in height. Due to its ornamental value and habitat specificity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
